website_summaries.verdict: Multi-featured titanium piece functions as a watch, navigation instrument, and workout assistant – perfect for outdoor data and sports enthusiasts.
pros: Tracking via omni-directional, stainless steel exo antenna, with GPS and GLONASS satellite reception
Has wrist heart rate technology and other fitness features such as display of advanced running parameters, e.g
vertical oscillation and ratio, Vo2 Max, and recovery adviser
Sunlight-readable display with durable sapphire lens
Outdoor navigation features: 3-axis compass, altimeter, barometer, and TracBack
cons: Some buyers cite issues with various features, especially altitude or barometer readings and fitness output data

customer_reviews.title: Broken altimeter twice!
customer_reviews.text: I received my first watch and the altimeter/barometer did not work. It would skyrocket to 50,000 feet in elevation and then drop to -50,000 feet in elevation in a matter of hours. I contacted Garmin support and they said to get a replacement (which is easy in Amazon.) My second watch arrived and in a matter of hours the altimeter/barometer did not work again. Same issue with the elevation. I guess I'm returning my second watch. I've been saving my money for over a year for this watch and I get crap. I'm very disappointed. I guess I'll look to see what Suunto has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is good (I run at least 3x a week and work ...
customer_reviews.text: a bit pricey but unlike my Fenix 2 I now where this as an everyday watch. Battery life is good (I run at least 3x a week and work out 5-6 times recording everything and only charge watch every couple weeks). And it even charges fast...maybe 1.5 hr if completely dead. Screen is very durable, I'm always scratching watches up working on cars etc, this one has taken the abuse and has no scratches yet....I did buy IQ SHIELD screen protectors for it though...they were a couple bucks with lifetime replacements. HR monitor better than expected, right in line with my NORDIC TRACK ELITE X9i chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: FrontLineTrainer

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch. I have the Apple Watch and sure it does more stuff and has more apps But it's such a hassle to always have to charge every night. The last thing we all need is another device to charge. The Garmin Fenix 3 battery lasts forever I am getting five or six days out of a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: one of the best products i have owned
customer_reviews.text: So far, one of the best products i have owned. I still need to research it as i have just got it today. But, the first few hours - brilliant sport device with the features that can be used out of sports. Got temp, pace and HR sensors connected ok. Cadence/Speed - to be connected tonight. Istalled HR sensor seems to be measuring my HR correctly (only slightly delayed displaying as it seems to me). Watch facing is slightly large for my wrist (i usually wear gloves size M), but i guess, i should live with that, if it was smaller, then obviously not as much data and options could be seen on a screen at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Cycling Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Great watch for activity tracking. 1- Rugged(kettle-bells etc.) and looks great. 2- It can do so much stuff with other apps. 3- Great battery life compared to AppleWatch etc. 4- Notifications etc. work great. Please remember to upgrade the firmware of the watch. I had an old firmware and i upgraded it to the latest version. Though obvious but please do remember that Fenix 3 firmware is different from Fenix 3 HR firmware.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPenName

customer_reviews.title: Simply Incredible.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot overstate how much this device has changed my life - went from mostly sedentary to getting a gym membership and a few Garmin devices to help motivate, and this does the trick. While a bit large and heavy, it does not bother me at all (keeping in mind I only use this for workouts and outdoor events, not daily wearing; I use the Garmin Vivosmart 3 for that). Packed with features, the chest strap works marvelously...could go on all day about it. Buy it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Connors

customer_reviews.title: Overall good watch/activity monitor
customer_reviews.text: By the third day of wearing the watch my skin was showing allergic reaction to the buckle on the silicone strap. Frustrated that a 600 dollar watch would have such a cheap buckle. I ordered the titanium band, it doesn't match the watch face and makes the watch heavier but I'm not itching. I like the programming, the menu are easy to use. The SUP profile is cool. I vary my activities bike,inline, xc ski, hike, etc.. The always on Optical HR is cool and I like the AVG Resting Heart Rate chart. The weather/calandar/notifications work well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Replace my Vivoactive 3 with Fenix 3. This one looks Rugged. Love the sapphire glass, not a single scratch, wear it all the time. Like the running dynamics info. Wish It could give stress level without HR strap. Battery life still the same 7 days, I run and ride about 4 times a week. Run with strap. Cons, had to get used to size, my wrist was sored first 3 runs, m a petite woman. Never use training option. Recovery time info is very nice feature so its VO2 max and race predictor.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Henriquez

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but not the worst.
customer_reviews.text: Tells the time and has a long list of physical activities that i liked. The only thing that is truly accurate about this is the compass and the altimeter. The step counter seemed a little off based on comparing it to a fitbit user. Also the heart rate sensor is terrible. I don't mind the size of it, the battery is incredible on this thing. My next watch will probably be a samsung watch that connects to your phone or an Apple watch because they are way more app friendly. But this watch is alright if your an exercise junky who runs on trails or swims and doesn't really mind it being a little inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally Suscces!
customer_reviews.text: My second Fenix 3 HR. I also have a 5, between the two, the 3 HR is my favorite. The stainless steel band delivers a nice touch. Nothing beats the chest strap for heartrate workouts. The wrist measures Hr great, BUT during exercise it gets shaken around to much to be really accurate. Day to day and sleeping HR monitoring is great!
customer_reviews.author: PJS

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid triathlete who does races as short as a mile up to 2x 140.6 distance races. I love this watch. It records everything I need it to, the battery lasts through a full 140.6 race for me, and the pseudo smart watch capabilities are just want i wanted. If you have the $$$, I recommend you buy this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Coopdave

customer_reviews.title: fenix 3 - great product
customer_reviews.text: A little big. Battery life is good. Am using barely 10% of its potential. A lot of features for sure. Very satisfied with the quality and weight of the product. useable screen is actually a little small (very big bezel). I am getting a little older, and the eyesight is not improving, so looking at the small display is not great. Integrates fairly well with the iPhone. Not seamless but adequate. I dont use enough features to justify the price I paid for it. A Vivoactive would have done just fine. I use it to track triathlon training and tracking mostly.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Syncing nightmare
customer_reviews.text: For this amount of money, it should sync. It worked for about half the day and after that maybe every 10th attempt or so went through. The rest just hung. My Fitbit had no problem syncing seamlessly to the same phone during this time. Syncing is really such a basic function that I'm just stunned the Garmin worked so poorly. It's not the sort of thing you should have to jump through hoops to do. We're talking the basics here. Honestly, after spending so much, the idea of suffering customer support is unbearable. Returned on day 1 and will go with a different company.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Shiny with some dull areas
customer_reviews.text: An overall great multisport watch that's super customizable. However, the GPS is not as accurate as the TomTom Spark watch and consistently comes in .35—1mi short. Additionally, the optical HR is not as accurate and steady as the TomTom Spark optical HR technology. Although it's very disappointing considering the price point, I prefer the Fenix 3 HR for its overall feature set. I'm hoping Garmin fixing these serious issues.
customer_reviews.author: GuruLee

customer_reviews.title: GPS signal problem
customer_reviews.text: this watch have a problem about GPS connection ! need about 15 m to receive GPS signal and start sport activity . Disappointing . i have 2 orders i will return soon :(
customer_reviews.author: ihab

customer_reviews.title: Saphire edition
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it so far. It's not a smart watch per se, although it does have some smart features to it. I wish it would Auto update the clock a few times throughout the day, without having to manually start a GPS function. Time keeping it pretty terrible, may not be a big deal to most people, but due to job requirements it is a pet peeve of mine. I knew this going in, so it obviously didn't stop me from buying it.
customer_reviews.author: M De

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic watch my husband loves it he has had it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic watch my husband loves it he has had it for 6 months now :) . It has some amazing features. Our favorite is the gps tracking it shows on the watch . He wears it every day charging it every night . He says it never gets below 70 present . It charges pretty fast as well . I would say if you enjoy being out doors hiking paddling fishing camping this is a great watch while still keeping up with text message an emails as long as your phone has service. Hope this helps you guys in making your choices feel free to ask questions I’ll do my best to get answers .
customer_reviews.author: Katie krieger

customer_reviews.title: Practical, Durable, and very much liked!
customer_reviews.text: My mom got this for my fiance who is an Army JAG as a law school graduation gift, and he absolutely loves it!! I would recommend the screen protector (can get on Amazon too), found that he was almost uncomfortable with the watch, afraid he'd scratch it I think, until we added that... but since then he wears it like he's had it forever. My fiance tends to be a bit hard on things, and it shows no real signs of wear. He is comfortable golfing in it too (neat features w/ GPS), although it did take him some getting used to it with his swing. No complaints, would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate watch.
customer_reviews.text: Owned the watch for 2 and half years. Used software to track fitness and had a run of 90days going when watch glitched and I lost my streak. Stair counter very inaccurate. Never know when it will work. Have tried to fix the problem but nothing Garmin suggests works. I'm an old skydiver and the altimeter is inaccurate and off by hundreds of feet even if you calibrate it.
customer_reviews.author: asdfghjkl555

customer_reviews.title: Just hit the add to cart button!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it....love it...love it!!!! Grabbed this on Amazon when it went on sale. I have never owned a Garmin as I made this purchase to upgrade from my Nike plus sports watch and I'm glad I did. Luv the HR feature. The watch is not as bulky as people claim as I am a female and have small wrist. It's user friendly and has a large display. The fact that it can be customized is also a plus. No problems whatsoever synching.
customer_reviews.author: Livinlife

customer_reviews.title: Great so far after 5 months heavy use!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My husband and I bought these mainly for our marathon training but I use it for biking and swimming a ton. The battery life has been great and I’ve been using it heavily for about 5 months now. My husband loves the golfing function the most. He’s more of a soccer player lifter guy so doesn’t use it as much as me though. We still have fun with the step and elevation goal competition between us.
customer_reviews.author: Layne and Melissa

customer_reviews.title: It tracks running metrics that are really useful and it is amazingly customizable
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was more than 5 stars. This watch is the bomb. It tracks running metrics that are really useful and it is amazingly customizable. I had issues getting it connected to my Android, but turned out to be my phone. Tech support was very patient and helpful. Yes this watch was pricey, but it does everything the others try to do. Buy it and you will like it!
customer_reviews.author: M Kelly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. Great features
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of detailed reviews out there on this watch. No need to duplicate here. Just adding my vote. Great watch. Great features. From form to function, it's been good for me. It did take a while to learn the buttons rather than touchscreen (as on my former VivoActive), but it's intuitive enough that a little practice goes a long way. Battery life is great. I usually charge on a Sunday and I still have about 30% battery life. That includes running Bluetooth. I do not run activity mode that often as my bike has a Garmin computer.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, slightly big for a woman
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Wish I was able to set alarms and timers and run a stop watch with ease in addition to all the apps and features. As a very small female this thing is also huge, but I've gotten used to it. I love it truly, it has inspired an interest in health and fitness and I depended on it to get through my work day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Fitness Watch
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from the Vivoactive which I have had for several years to the Fenix 3. It is pretty simple to set up and use and the built in heart monitor is fairly accurate. I have used it to bike and run thus far and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch. However
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch. However... Amazon sold this to me as a "NEW" product, turns out it was refurbished. Already registered to someone else. Paid full price for a watch that someone else used, identified as defective, and returned to Amazon. When I reach out to manufacturer for remediation, find out that someone else registered it. Classy, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Sleeper
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. This watch just doesn't get the attention it deserves. Hands down better than any top advertised smart watch out there today. I have been wearing this consistently since I purchased it. The price is a bit much but compared even to the Apple Watch or Fitbit this is a far better product. Sapphire which makes it tough enough for any situation, and I have put it through the paces with of course many more to come. Way more options than most any smart watch and I don't have to have my phone all the time to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Earnest

customer_reviews.title: Irreplaceable
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great upgrade from my Forerunner 235. Multiple long runs (20+) miles on a single charge. Great interface, lots of options ( honestly most I don't even use), very very durable. I've taken several big spills in the woods and this watch still have a single scratch.
customer_reviews.author: yepthatsme

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't quite work the way I was hoping, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for multisport use, and particularly for stand up paddling and outrigger canoe paddling. It works fine for cycling and running, however the watch does not track me on the water. The watch collects the route data correctly, but for whatever reason speed isn't tracked, which skews the total distance. After each workout on the water I go to Google Maps and retrace the route on that site to get the correct distance. Then I go to edit the workout within the Garmin Connect site to correct the distance. It's quite disappointing that it doesn't work as advertised, even after turning on GLONASS and setting the watch to take a reading every second.
customer_reviews.author: SAE

customer_reviews.title: Garmin stuff is good
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good device. It has everything you would want. Unfortunately I had to return it. Maybe mine was defective, or maybe it was the environments I was using it in, but I had trouble reading the screen. From all the photos, it looks like the screen is nice and bright and easy to see. Mine wasn't that easy to see though.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt II

customer_reviews.title: Bought this bad boy last year as a Xmas gift for myself
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bad boy last year as a Xmas gift for myself. It's pretty nice. Battery actually only lasts the 14 days if you have the phone notifications turned off. The Heart Rate monitor doesn't actually give you an accurate reading. Holding it in my hand by the wristband it continues to read in the 100's bpm.
customer_reviews.author: Fieldy Snutts

customer_reviews.title: Crap, would love to return if i could. WASTE of money
customer_reviews.text: HR doesn’t work properly. Distance meter is a joke, he keeps counting meters even if you are in the same place.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio Buchner

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, with some bugs that need to be fixed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Fenix 3 HR for three weeks, which has given me enough time to tinker with it. Overall, the watch is great - it delivers on all its functionality, looks good and is easy to setup. The only downside is that when I set the time to automatic, my watch is nearly 2 mins slower. I have had to resort to setting time manually, but the downside is that other timezones dont adjust manually and show incorrect time. I am still trying to figure out how to get the auto time setting to reflect accurate time, so any suggestions are welcome.
customer_reviews.author: S. K

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought Garmin fenix 3 HR from Amazon US on Feb 18, 2018. I found lot of crack on the back of Garmin fenix 3 HR in Dec 2018. Waterproof was valid ,so I haven't repaired it. In January 2019 I found water come in it. This is a quality problem of the Garmin fenix 3 HR, No artificial damage is used normally. Not in the USA, repairing the Garim fenix 3 HR need to pay at least USD183.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: opsdfjlkdfs'
customer_reviews.text: the app take this watch to the next level. upload is easy. if you have a pairing problem follow these steps is the watch on ? turn BT on your phone turn BT paring on the watch. go to your phone BT screen and open the fenix 3 hr tap on your phone once you tap on the BT tap on your phone the phone will ask for a password. now go to you fenix watch on the watch display will be your BT code enter that code on the phone display and you are set. not the garmin app and sync with you watch.
customer_reviews.author: nathaniel rubio

customer_reviews.title: The app/ fuctions are great. GPS comes right up HR seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: use it for everything now all my other watches sit in their case. battery last a long time ,except when you use GPS for a day of snowbaording ,but still can go 2 days ! the display is a little hard to see in certain light. The app/ fuctions are great. GPS comes right up HR seems to be accurate. Great tool if you use it!
customer_reviews.author: rideteachersnowpro

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Fenix 3. Got two, ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fenix 3. Got two, one for the wife and one for myself. Then the Fenix came out with an on-board heart rate monitor so i had to have it. I still use my HR external though when i run. It is an added plus to have HR data for my general daily activities. I gave my other Fenix 3 to my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: tdlivings

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this watch
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this watch, I have it almost for 2 weeks now and I enjoy it, keeps things simple, works seamlessly with my iphone, and now I can keep a close track of my activities and keep me motivated to go beyond my regular activities, I love the fact that it does not have touch screen, and the battery last much more that the other smart devices, the GPS is pretty accurate, I used in USA and in Colombia and works perfectly. Very well done Garmin, I just hope you keep improving the number of apps and please keep it simple, "DO NOT GO TOUCH SCREEN".......I repeat "DO NOT GO TOUCH SCREEN".....
customer_reviews.author: tturbay

customer_reviews.title: Only a few improvements needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice watch. The face of the watch and the bezel scratched very quickly. Also, while using the GPS my wrist or coat kept hitting the side button and turning the GPS off. I would not want to trust this on a serious wilderness hike. Other than the items mentioned I really like the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Whackmaster B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for people who cross train, want long battery life and solid all round wearable watch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent battery life, awesome download screens for biking and running, easy to figure out despite all the features, lots of watch faces for normal wear, I am extremely pleased and has enhanced my workouts. Would highly recommend for anyone interested in training feedback and day to day activities like calories, heart rate, steps etc, in addition to workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch and the everyday design
customer_reviews.text: Great watch....I am amazed at all the things it does and the battery life....BT to the Garmin Connect app on the phone in <1min. I have used it for runs and biking...can't wait for open water swimming to start. It looked big compared to my last watch, but after a few days I don't feel it and I would not want it smaller for the activity information Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Baugher

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Multi-sport Watch
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. Great battery life if you're not using the GPS. GPS will last for about 1 day if using the GPS non stop. Took me a few days to get use to the size of the watch as I have small wrists, but overall I love it. I bought it for downhill skiing and have been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I like the watch
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch, but can't wear it because it is too large. I ordered a tool to adjust the band and it is on a slow boat from china.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: sold it to get this one with a nice discount (amazon black friday weekend)
customer_reviews.text: First time user, had an AW, sold it to get this one with a nice discount (amazon black friday weekend). This is not a fancy apple watch with useless apps. The Fenix is a tool, with better options than Apple Watch and better battery life. The GPS/Glonass is terrific, played golf yesterday and against my Bushnell Rangefinder the difference was less than 2 yards. Satisfied 110%
customer_reviews.author: Jesus M. Gonzalez Morales

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite purchases in awhile
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite purchases in awhile. I've had it for about 2 months. Battery life is great, features are awesome (I run and bike). This has made fitness a lot more fun for me and helps keep me engaged. No issues with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brant R Newman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love Garmin! Love the watch!! Had the Fenix 2 and the 3 is so much more advanced it's crazy! The cost was hard to swallow, but I'd buy it again. Battery lasts a very long time and the wireless connection to upload activities is amazing!! So helpful! Track back, Paddleboarding, and the HR monitor in the wrist are just a few of the improvements, not to mention weather viewing abilities!!
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great! A lot of functionality and pragmatism. I love the fact of having the Heart Rate sensor on the wrist, because it's way more comfortable. Mainly for long races.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin F Taborda C

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is awesome!! Extremely durable, I’m never worried about it breaking. Extremely reliable, the battery last for a good couple days even with good usage. And extremely helpful, keep track of heart rate, steps taken, your sleep schedule, and a lot of other cool features!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday training watch!
customer_reviews.text: This watch has by far exceeded my expectations! I wear it everyday. I use it to track my runs, steps, heart rate, sleep, calories. It look great, many watch face to choose from. The screen is very easy to see in broad day light, I barely use the backlight because of that. I wish it can out years ago. I also use it with the HRM run for more run details, this is a great add-on.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Fortier

customer_reviews.title: but when you do it will track you with amazing
customer_reviews.text: From experience it will not motivate you to workout, but when you do it will track you with amazing accuracy
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: I can only assume it is a very good all around smart
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit as a gift for my brother who happens to be an outdoors sports person. He says he loves everything about this gadget. Since he can't stop talking about how much he likes it, I can only assume it is a very good all around smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: DSF

customer_reviews.title: Great but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Great matrial and quality used to make this watch . If you are into working out .i highly recommended having one of these .The only issues with Garmin watches is the price . They aren't over priced, they are just expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: ... watch a little over a year and it works great and goes everywhere with an outstanding battery life
customer_reviews.text: Had this watch a little over a year and it works great and goes everywhere with an outstanding battery life. I also enjoy the notifications/alerts it provides so I don't have to check my phone all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, fairly accurate, nice style
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for a week already. It was easy to set up and sync with the connect app. I find the calories burned counter is off. I’ve had other fitness tracking watches before and my readings on calories are pretty off. I love everything about the watch except for the minor inaccuracies and it is kind of bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: loved it, best watch ever, very beautiful and works great. The app is the worst in the market, i changed from sunnto to garmin and i miss the app, but the watch it self is very beautiful and works great for all the diferent workouts. You can customize the info on the watch perfectly. Its great !!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Cherem

customer_reviews.title: YCZ!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband, he's super picky about stuff and he's so impossible to buy for but he loves this watch and wears it daily. He tracks his golf games, snowboard runs, and his dirt biking crap.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli B

customer_reviews.title: Best running watch so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a handful of watches for running and this is the best one.. It looks and feels right with a quality build. As a bonus it works and has a great battery life. Lasts about 7 days. Garmin has a nice selection of watch faces, too. It's not cheap, so i bought it telling myself I'd return it if I wasn't completely happy.. I am, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Max&Ruby

customer_reviews.title: th wrist based HR is very close to the earlier chest strap monitor- great job.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the additional features when compared to my fenix 2, and forerunner 225..... Run dynamics, watch face options, activity tracking widgets etc.., certainly make it worth every penny paid for...th wrist based HR is very close to the earlier chest strap monitor- great job.....and garmin gets it right with the looks too making it all the more worth it...The only catch-hard to sleep with this bulky watch...., so more often give my sleep tracking a miss...
customer_reviews.author: Sashi

customer_reviews.title: impressive!
customer_reviews.text: loving this WATCH (not just a fitness tracker)...its a legitimate WATCH too (something i couldn't get from any other fitness tracker). a solid 5-7 days between charges (even w/ bluetooth & wireless connections). No problem at all being able to see this in direct sunlight or even inside (at night).
customer_reviews.author: Don R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from my Forerunner. Good battery life. Lots of options for customization.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Great watch but large face.
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this watch! Great for keeping track of fitness goals. You can purchase additional bands. It's a bit large for a woman so I purchased Garmin Forerunner 235 however I wish Garmin offered everything in this watch for petite/smaller wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is really good too, way better then my Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bf. He loves it! The heart monitor is very accurate as well as the calorie counter. The battery life is really good too, way better then my Apple Watch, i highly recommend it for people who Are active, it has a lot of different sports modes and tracks your daily step ya and quality of sleep
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Thewatch was delivered in pristine condition and on time
customer_reviews.text: The watch was delivered in pristine condition and on time. Watch looks very solid and durable. I am very happy with it. Setup and pairing with my smartphone was very simple and was able to download golf course and sync with the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil D.

customer_reviews.title: this is good. but loose 10% of point for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect smart activity watch. I'm fully satisfied with the function Fenix 3 has. but I just cut the 1 star, because they are not support multi-language in their OS. I mean, the OS is ok. but the problem is notification. I live in South KOREA now and most of my notification is by KOREAN. email and text, even call. I would like to investigate by myself, but it's not easy, so I just get rid of 1 star in the rate. but still fully functional and 90% satisfied watch to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the best purchase I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best purchase I've ever made. I wear it ALL the time. Most recently hiked MT Fuji. Had the climb function on the entire time and it tracked the whole 9.5 hour, 14 mile evolution and still had enough battery left to last the weekend. I am VERY impressed by this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Bart M.

customer_reviews.title: Man's watch
customer_reviews.text: Timer is buried to deep in menus. Everything else is great. Update: A user commented that you can use hot Keys to make the timer a one button operation. Another said there are timer apps as well. I will check these both out and comment soon.
customer_reviews.author: HoldenRider

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money--lots of software problems
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't directly auto-sync with Training Peaks-- and it also has issues tracking daily steps history. I wish I had waited and bought the Fenix5 which they had fixed the software problems on! This is NOT worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rozanne Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Hardware problems after 3 months.  o
customer_reviews.text: After 3-1/2 months, the fenix 3 hr stopped acquiring a gps signal. Tried everything per Garmin support and spend several hours restarting and backing up data. This is the second Garmin product, which I will be returning. I also owned a Garmin Vivo active for 1 day. It would not start up upon unboxing, so I returned it and bought the Fenix 3 HR. I guess it's time for me to try another brand of fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy my Fenix 3
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my Fenix 3. I only rate it at a 3 star for the fact of heart rate monitor is slightly off from time to time (not a huge deal) and I wish you could edit steps tracked, this tends to get way off. I wake up in the mornings and have steps already tracked from sleep (wrist movement). If they fixed the steps editing it would for sure be 4star. Really love the golf tracking of distances on the greens.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it. 1.5 week battery with Bluetooth on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Reader25

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gear if you are serious about fitness ...
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of gear if you are serious about fitness analytics. I do a lot of OCR and it works well for that. Only issue is during lifting days the wrist HR monitor is not very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: jp cashla

customer_reviews.title: but this is an amazing watch! Does everything it says it does and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am usually not one to leave reviews, but this is an amazing watch! Does everything it says it does and more. Heart rate is super accurate other than when i am lifting weights(as expected)
customer_reviews.author: Nick Day

customer_reviews.title: Watch is good - tracks activities well
customer_reviews.text: Watch is good - tracks activities well, good battery life, and notifications. Looks much better. However the lock on the Titanium band came off loose after only 2 months of regular usage, rendering the watch pretty useless without a new band. May 2020: The watch is still going strong after 2 years of daily use. Use it track my running and biking. Ran my first ultra with it. Garmin sent me replacement titanium band for the issue that I wrote above.
customer_reviews.author: Arun N

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch. It has only frozen on me once, but i held the light and start button for about :20 to restart it. Make sure to download Garmin Connect to track all of your data.
customer_reviews.author: manins4

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend getting the Screen Protector with it just for additional ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch for my hubby's birthday and he absolutely loves it. It's been 5 months since the purchase and we have had absolutely no issues. I'd recommend getting the Screen Protector with it just for additional scratch resistance. Overall, super satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Torres

customer_reviews.title: Good value too
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a fitness watch more than a smartwatch. This one takes care of my active needs (golf, gym and biking) while giving alerts for texts and calls. The battery is very impressive. More features than I'll ever be able to use. Good value too. Glad it was still available with the Fenix 5 out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Waltho

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fitness watch. It does everything and does everything well. The only thing it needs to be a perfect 10, is to have storage to load songs. This would completely eliminate the need to carry any other device while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Margarito C.

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best watches I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best watches I have purchased. The Fenix 3 HR is extremely durable, and the features are useful. The only issue that the watch seems to have is that it has limited memory storage. Though the Fenix 3 HR was never meant to be similar to Samsung or Apple smart watches.
customer_reviews.author: BigNose

customer_reviews.title: Get them while they are still available.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent execution of fully functional watch. Love real buttons instead of touch screen. All [or close] the functions of the new 5, but huge price savings.
customer_reviews.author: Zimmm

customer_reviews.title: He says it's great and is still learning all of the ins and ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say a little more about it but it was a gift for my husband who does several OCR races across the country. He requested this one im-particular for his needs. He says it's great and is still learning all of the ins and outs. Everyday he finds a new feature but and seems to be very pleased. Great for training. He said he was pleasantly surprised on the height of the watch and thought it would be much taller on his wrist than it actually is. Overall I think it was a successful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great. Can now track my hikes and bikes with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great. Can now track my hikes and bikes with GPS tracks. Now exact mileage, time, and elevation gain.
customer_reviews.author: Tired

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch but it came with a defective battery that needs to be recharged daily.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: There is a Bluetooth connectivity issue. I have to ...
customer_reviews.text: There is a Bluetooth connectivity issue. I have to restart iPhone and Fenix 3HR several times in order to pair the watch to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love my garmin fenix 3 . We used it for many activities. Golf, boating, swimming, biking and running. Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: H.R.Rider

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for fitness or people with health concerns
customer_reviews.text: Might be one of the best health watches around. If you have any heart problems this is a must. Having the ability for the "accurate" continuous heart rate monitoring is huge and to do so without the chest strap is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Faceoff4

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good with this watch. I've had the watch for approx 2 months and it's worked like a charm. I don't really have any complaints. I love the wrist heart monitor. It seems pretty accurate. The ap store is really nice (garmin connect) and everything in there has been free, so far. Changing the watch faces has made this feel like a new watch over and over again. My wife has a Fitbit Surge and the step counters don't really match up. I can't say that it's her watch or mine that's off. It's not by much, and for me, it's not really a major concern.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Ru

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: GPS went out after 6 weeks of use but Garmin replaced with a new fenix 5 for my trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works great, seems very durable
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of this watch, I've had it for a little while. Works great, seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: OAK667

customer_reviews.title: The watch is beautiful, but a bit overkill for me
customer_reviews.text: The watch is beautiful, but a bit overkill for me. I found the OHR to be wildly inaccurate, couple that with Garmin connect being buggy I ended up returning this. I went back to my Polar V800, not as sexy, but better for my training. For a $600 dollar watch Garmin should also provide a better paint option for the bezel.
customer_reviews.author: ef

customer_reviews.title: love the downloadable and customized watch face options
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the large side to sleep in; love the downloadable and customized watch face options.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marovich

customer_reviews.title: All the features of my old Vivoactive HR & more ...
customer_reviews.text: All the features of my old Vivoactive HR & more, with a stylish look that can be worn at any occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Swim coach 49

customer_reviews.title: Great activity tracker for active individuals who also want to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very robust and rugged. Great activity tracker for active individuals who also want to wear their watch while on duty. IPhone app provides a lot of great information on your activity levels, sleep, heart rate, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Great watch! I use it to map my bike rides and track daily steps counts. Wish I sprung for one with a heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: George Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. My other nicer watches have taken a back seat to this one. Has all kind of features I haven't even used yet. I wear it everyday. Charge last about 7 days with GPS turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Sim Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: pretty nice product but the HRM sticks out from the back too far and is irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie & Jason Procell

customer_reviews.title: Just too big, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this watch. The functionality is all there, the aesthetic is great - but the overall dimensions are just too large for me to want to wear outside of exercising, and are even big enough to become annoying during exercise. The weight is enough to be considered - but it's mostly the diameter and depth of the watch that are prevent me from keeping this watch. Hoping to see a scaled down version in the future!
customer_reviews.author: blargh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sport watches, I'm using it for walking and running
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sports Computer
customer_reviews.text: Love this sports computer on my arm. It does so much still learning highly impressed with all I've done so far!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The best training tool
customer_reviews.text: The best training gadget I've ever had. Had a Forerunner 405 before that I was satisfied with but it's nothing compared to Fenix 3 HR. I'm not to sure about the accuracy when it comes to the sleep tracking but it's ok. It finds satellites immediately, connects to my older heart rate band and bicycle equipment. I can really recommend this for running, swimming, skiing and bicycling which I've used it for so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best garmin ever
customer_reviews.text: The best garmin ever, I had forerunner 620 i miss the touch screen but for everything else a superb watch
customer_reviews.author: Telesforo Fernandez

product_meta.title: Garmin fenix 3 GPS Watch, Gray
product_meta.description:
Configuration:New| Style:Fenix 3

UNCOMPROMISING MULTISPORT TRAINING GPS WATCH
 * Stainless Steel EXO antenna with GPS + GLONASS support for fast fix and accuracy
 * 1.2-inch sunlight readable color Chroma display
 * Fitness training features like VO2 Max and Recovery Advisor (when used with a heart rate monitor¹)
 * Outdoor navigation features like 3-axis compass, altimeter and barometer, TracBack and Sight’n Go
 * Connect IQ compatibility for customized apps, widgets, watch faces and data fields

fēnix 3 is the rugged, capable and smart multisport training GPS watch. With feature sets for fitness training plus feature sets for outdoor navigation, fēnix 3 is ready for any training activity and competition. Access to the Connect IQ platform allows customization of watch faces, data fields, widgets and activities. And, fēnix 3 is a thin, light multisport training GPS that won’t slow you down whether for training or every day use.

SERIOUS STYLE THAT STANDS UP TO THE ROUGHEST CONDITIONS
fēnix 3 is available in 3 bold models: gray with high-strength, scratch resistant, crystal and black band; silver with red band; and the premium sapphire model with a stainless steel band and sapphire lens. Each watch features a protective stainless steel bezel and buttons, and reinforced housing for extra durability. A sunlight-visible high-resolution color Chroma display with LED backlight lets you access your data in any light. fēnix 3 is water rated 100 meters and has a battery life of up to 50 hours in UltraTrac mode, 16 hours in GPS mode and up to 3 months in watch mode (all depending on settings).

ADVANCED FITNESS METRICS
fēnix 3 is packed with training features to tell you about your form and fitness. The first is the VO2 max estimator. When used with a heart rate monitor¹, fēnix 3 crunches data, including your running speed, beats per minute and heart rate variability to estimate the maximum volume of oxygen you can consume per minute. Track changes to your VO2 max to see your fitness gains and to compare with your peers. Other fitness metrics include recovery advisor with a recovery timer and recovery check, plus a Race Predictor, which estimates your ideal finish time based on your current VO2 max number.

RUNNING DYNAMICS FEATURES
fēnix 3 incorporates sophisticated Garmin running watch feedback on your running form by reporting multiple metrics. When used with the HRM-Run monitor¹, fēnix 3 reports your cadence, vertical oscillation and ground contact time. These metrics are called running dynamics, and they affect your running economy.

SWIM PROFILE AND SKI-BOARD MODE
The fēnix 3 isn’t just for running; special feature sets help swim training and skiing too. Borrowing from the Garmin Swim, fēnix 3 tracks your distance, pace, stroke count and more. You just tell fēnix 3 the size of the pool you’re swimming in and begin your workout. Ski-board mode puts speed, distance, vertical drop and an automatic run counter (with Auto Pause for the lift line) and more at your fingertips. You can even use your fēnix 3 as a glove-friendly remote, via ANT+, for the VIRB and VIRB Elite action cameras.

NAVIGATE YOUR WAY
No other navigator GPS plus ABC (altimeter, barometer and compass) wristwatch offers you the combined training functions and our leading GPS technology. fēnix 3 provides comprehensive navigation and tracking functionalities to guide you on and off the beaten track. Its built-in sensors provide information on heading, elevation and weather changes.

It records a GPS track log creating a “bread crumb trail” as you move. It also allows you to mark locations, such as a start/finish line, course checkpoint, or a campsite, vehicle or other point of interest. With fēnix 3, you can create and follow courses, mark up to 1,000 locations and store up to 10,000 track points and navigate to them.

Plan trips and share adventures with friends and family using BaseCamp. fēnix is equipped with both ANT+ and Bluetooth Smart capabilities to wirelessly share locations, routes and geocaches.

ALTIMETER, BAROMETER AND COMPASS


fēnix 3 is equipped with ABC sensors to provide relevant real-time information. The built-in altimeter provides elevation data to accurately monitor ascent and descent, while the barometer can be used to predict weather changes by showing short-term trends in air pressure. The 3-axis electronic compass keeps your bearing whether you’re moving or not.

fēnix 3 auto-calibrates its ABC sensors using its GPS receiver and also auto sets the time based on location. For an extremely accurate temperature reading, pair it with our tempe external temperature sensor.

CONNECT IQ
fēnix 3 uses the ConnectIQ platform for specialized software so you can personalize your watch with apps, widgets, data fields and unique watch faces that make your Garmin smartwatch even smarter.

STAY CONNECTED
Smart Notifications lets you receive emails, texts and alerts right on your watch, even if you're on the trail. fēnix 3 receives the wireless signal from a compatible iPhone 4s or Android smartphone and let’s you know you have a message, displaying the text on its own screen whenever you’re ready to read it.

In the Box:

 * fēnix 3 - gray watch with black band
 * USB charging/data cable
 * AC adapter
 * Quick start manual



¹Heart rate monitors and HRM-run, sold separately.
²When paired with your iPhone 4S or later, Bluetooth or Bluetooth Smart Ready phones. See compatible list at http://support.garmin.com/support/searchSupport/case.faces?caseId={bbfc9660-8f77-11e3-d5f4-000000000000}. The Bluetooth word mark and logos are registered trademarks owned by Bluetooth SIG, INC. iPhone is a trademark of Apple Inc. Android is a trademark of Google Inc.
feature_bullets: Chroma display - 1.2” sunlight-visible high-resolution color Chroma optically-bonded display.Quick fit watch band compatible: 0.8Inch(26 mm)
Water rating - water rated up to 10ATM/ 100 Meters1; suitable for swimming. Case Material: fiber-reinforced polymer
Exo antenna - Omni-directional Steel exo antenna, when paired with GLONASS and epo, provides an even faster fix and accurate position than GPS alone
Wireless connectivity- utilize one or more Wi-Fi Hot spots to automatically sync your data with Garmin connect and update software (when in range)
Battery life - rechargeable battery; up to 20 hours in training/GPS mode, 50 hours in UltraTrac mode, and 6 weeks in watch mode (depends on settings)
